loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 
She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.
Janette has been in this business for seven years. Janette earns more income from selling charcoal and trisikad (pedicab) transportation.
Janette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to build and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 50-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children. He is a farmer dealing in maize production and his major clients are maize millers. The seasonal nature of the business and theft affect his business while his dreams are to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and to venture into mechanized agriculture. Charles intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a 31-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda.  He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children.  He is a farmer dealing in maize production in a rural area whereby produce sellers are his major clients.  Weather changes affect his business while his dream is to educate his children up to university level.  Pascal intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Phiscaria

texts.en: Phiscaria is married with one child who is very young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. She operates a butcher shop, and her major challenge is seasonality. With the loan of KSH 25,000 she wants to purchase a weighing scale machine for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing scale machine for her business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married with two children who go to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a poultry business and her greatest challenge is diseases. She sells to her neighbors and market dwellers.

Zawadi is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase poultry feed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed for her business.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is 51 years old and lives in Masindi–Uganda. He is married and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of nine children. 

He is a farmer and also has a retail shop in order to meet the daily family expenses. Produce buyers and maize millers are his major clients and his dream is to venture into mechanized agriculture.  

Wilberforce intends to use the loan to pay workers who are ploughing and weeding his gardens.

loans.use: to pay workers who are ploughing and weeding his gardens.

loans.name: Kiet

texts.en: Kiet, aged 43, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. They have been running a business of selling CDs for four years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying different CDs to better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy CDs for selling in his music store.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim, aged 33, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard in his residential quarter. She earns an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

She started this business twelve years ago. She sells many kinds of dishes to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Ume  Kalsoom

texts.en: Ume Kalsoom is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous in providing good quality products in her circle. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers for her carpet-making business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is 38 years old, living in the Gurjaani district with her retired mother and three children. Nino is widowed. She works as a baker at the local bakery and works hard all day long to earn a living. Her children are school aged and get a monthly orphans pension from the government. The family lives in poverty and gets a small-sized social assistance as well. Besides, Nino grows tomatoes on the plot of land and sells them seasonally. The family owns a horse which is used in wood transportation from the forest. Nino’s son sells the wood to locals during winter. But the existing income is modest and not enough for covering everyday costs. That’s why Nino decided to start up a trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Nino’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfied their requirements. She received this credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 800 GEL she will purchase household items: blankets, bed-clothing, vessels, etc at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. Her regular customers will be her co-workers and neighbors. It is obvious that the job is hard for Nino, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase household items for selling

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man, with two children aged 3 and 6 years old. 

Geoffrey describes himself as neat. He operates a clothes shop where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that the rainy seasons affect his business. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. His business goal is to open a chain of boutiques within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will meet all his family's needs. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en: Truphena is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a shop where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of curtains for resale. Her business goal is to own a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big stall full of curtains. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of curtains for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a 48-year-old woman. She describes herself as excellent. She operates a tailoring shop where she repairs clothes and also makes new clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funding. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cloth, threads and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own more than five tailoring shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, threads and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Oclar

texts.en: Oclar is a 45 year old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 5 to 26. She describes herself as organized. She operates a timber store where she sells timber and firewood. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are carpenters. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that some customers buy timber on credit and fail to pay on time. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase more timber. Her goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to raise the living standard of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more timber

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 12 to 25. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She manages rental houses where she charges customers to stay in her houses. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of building materials. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy nails, timber and other materials for repairing her rental houses. Her goal is to expand and have more rental houses within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy nails, timber and other materials for repairing her rental houses

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 52-year-old married man with 5 children. He describes himself to be smart. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and fruits to sell. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a very good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of money to buy supplies. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds and farming materials. He hopes that in the future, he will excel in farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming materials.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 30-year-old woman with one child. She describes herself to be smart and excellent. She operates a bakery where she bakes cakes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are supermarkets and shops. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funding. 

Miriam will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil etc for baking cakes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excell.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be a good man. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes and potatoes. His farm is located in an area that is good for farming and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate funding. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs i.e seeds, fertilizers, etc. His business goal is to be the main producer of potatoes and tomatoes in the area he lives within the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs i.e seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 38-year-old single mother of two children aged 17 and 14 years old. She has been selling grocery goods for the past ten years and has seen her business grow steadily. She now earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 after boosting her stock with the previous loans that she borrowed.

She wishes to boost her business and has requested a sixth loan of KES 50,000 to help her purchase more fruit, vegetables and sacks of charcoal. The profit she earns will contribute towards her purchasing a piece of land. She hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables and sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Mila is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with four children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She cooks various foods such as rice, beans and flat bread and sells to her neighbors and passersby.
She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil and rice to cook and make more sales.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil and rice to cook to make more sales

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 60 years old and widowed with 3 children.
Lucila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.
Lucila has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from E-loading (prepaid mobile load).
Lucila aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Christine Mae

texts.en:
Christine Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and earns more income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy additional equipment and materials for her fishing business.

Christine Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elma has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

Elma requested a PHP 8000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Gambari

texts.en:
Gambari is a married man with four children who go to school.  He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.
He operates a clothing business and he has been in this business for the last eight years.  His major challenge is seasonality.
He is requesting a loan of KES.50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He joined Yehu to gain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with two children, one who is underage and the other goes to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

Salima operates a clothes selling business and she cites seasonality as her greatest challenge.

With the loan of KES.20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes and to renovate her house. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
En la fotografía, aparece Jesús con su pequeña hija.

Don Jesús posee 48 años de edad, acompañado y con tres hijos; el primero  de 15 años,  el segundo de  9 años  y la última una niña de  5 años, todos viven con él. Jesús, por su parte, logro  estudiar hasta  6° grado  de educación básica,  su compañera de vida se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos del hogar, pero cuando la situación lo amerita se incorpora a las labores agrícolas.  


Él, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos   y hortalizas, trabajo  que desde corta edad lo aprendió  al  lado  de su padre y por las  circunstancias de la vida desde entonces (9 años) se dedica a esta actividad productiva. A  parte de la siembra,  se dedica a la albañilería oficio que le permite obtener otros ingresos adicionales en época seca.  La distancia desde su casa  y el cultivo  es de  aproximadamente 1 kilómetro; pero  desde la entrada de la comunidad cuando transporta los insumos  la distancia es de 5 kilómetros  y se recorren a pie.     

Con el préstamo realizara la compra de abonos sólidos (3 qq)  y foliares (2 lt), insecticidas (1/4), fungicidas (1 galón), para la siembra de 1.000 plantas de tomate  y  500 de chile. Esperando obtener ingresos para realizar el pago  del préstamo  y que le genere excedentes para  suplir las necesidades  familiares, como mejor alimentación, mantener el apoyo para que sus hijos continúen realizando  estudios básicos. 
En el futuro el señor pretende incrementar su unidad de producción a 3.000 plantas de tomate  y diversificar el cultivo,  con pepino, zanahoria, Repollo, etc. Ya que podrá abrirse mercado  en la ciudad y generar mayores ingresos económicos para él  y su familia.

Para sus hijos, espera enseñarles lo necesario para defenderse en la vida. A demás, del estudio a nivel medio al menos  que les permitirá la opción de encontrar un trabajo que les permita salir de las condiciones de pobreza  con las que la familia vive actualmente.
texts.en:
Jesús and his young daughter are pictured above.

Jesús is 48 years old, in a relationship, and has three children; the first is 15, the second is 9, and the youngest is a 5-year-old girl.  They all live with him.  Jesús, for his part, was able to get a sixth grade education.  His life partner takes care of the housework, but when the situation calls for it she helps out with the farm work.  

He grows staple grains and vegetables for a living.  He learned to do this work at a very young age by his father's side and due to life's circumstances, he has been working in this productive business since he was nine years old.  Aside from planting, he works in construction, which provides him with additional income during the dry season.  The distance from his house to his crops is about 1 km, but the entrance to the community where he transports his supplies is 5 km and he goes on foot.

With this loan he will buy solid fertilizers (300 lbs), spray fertilizers (2 l), insecticides (1/4), and fungicides (1 gal) for his crops of 1,000 tomato plants and 500 chili plants.  He hopes to make enough profits to repay his loan and have a surplus to supply his family with necessities, such as better nutrition, and to keep supporting his children so they can continue their primary education.  

In the future he hopes to increase his production to 3,000 tomato plants and to diversify his crops with cucumbers, carrots, cabbage, etc. as he will be able to expand his market in the city and generate more income for himself and for his family.  

He hopes to teach his children what they need to know to take care of themselves in life.  He also hopes to give them at least a mid-level education, which will give them the option of finding work that will allow them to get out the conditions of poverty in which the family currently lives.

loans.use: to buy solid fertilizers (300 lbs), spray fertilizers (2 l), insecticides (1/4), and fungicides (1 gal) for his crops of 1,000 tomato plants and 500 chili plants.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 2 children aged 7 and 16 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a cereals store where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a busy area and has a varied array of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy bulk maize for resale. He also runs a motorcycle transport business. He will use the anticipated profits to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more maize for resale

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 30-year-old man married to Juliet and together they are blessed with three children between 2 and 9 years old. He runs a mobile money transfer services in Kericho. He also sales airtime cards. He has been in this business for the last two years. From this business he earns a monthly income of KES 41,600. He has requested a loan of KES 60,000 that he will use KES 20,000 to purchase airtime cards, KES 30,000 to increase his mobile money float and the remainder to meet other overhead costs.
He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a plot of land and open a new business. His dream is to build a strong, large business empire.

loans.use: to pay for airtime to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 8 to 20 years old. 

Jane describes herself to be patient. She operates a cereal store where she sells maize, beans, sorghum etc. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a market place and her primary customers are schools. 

She will use the KES 75,000 loan to add stock of maize, beans and other cereals to resell. Her business goal is to open another store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate and feed her family.

loans.use: add stock of maize, beans and other cereals to her store.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 27 years old, married to Nancy and blessed with a two-year-old child.  He owns a retail shop where he sells soft drinks and snacks, a business he started nine years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase crates of sodas and other soft drinks. The profit he earns will help him to expand this business. He hopes to see his business grow as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas and other soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 28 years of age, married to Millicent and blessed with a two-year-old baby. He is in the welding business which he started seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has requested a third loan of KES 60,000 to purchase a new gas cylinder for welding purposes. The profit he earns will help him to expand his business. His dreams are to lead a comfortable and successful life as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a gas cylinder for welding.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joy is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a  Kiva borrower. She has one child. She describes herself as honest and faithful. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as changes in climatic conditions. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of bananas, tomatoes, onions and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of bananas, tomatoes, onions and other items

loans.name: Moreene

texts.en: Moreene is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children who are 1 and 3 years old. She describes herself to be self-driven. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatments, weaving, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are females. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate amounts of beauty products. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cosmetics and salon equipment. Her business goal is to own a larger hair salon within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide beauty services to a larger clientele.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and salon equipment.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel, es un joven de 19 años de edad, oriundo de la población de Sopachuy, soltero, culmina su bachillerato estudiando en las noches. El señor Fidel junto a su madre radican en el trópico hace cuatro años en busca de mejor vida. Su madre compro un chaco pequeño,  donde tienen plantaciones de piña y cítricos, esta producción les permite  solventar sus gastos, sin embargo no les alcanza ya que Fidel quiere estudiar y ser profesional, por esta razón empezó a estudiar en las noches para salir bachiller y luego estudiar una carrera, ahora el señor Fidel  alquilo un cuarto en otra población y trabaja como moto taxista en el día, esta es la razón por lo que Fidel solicita el crédito, el quiere renovar su herramienta de trabajo, comprándose un motocicleta nueva y así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fidel is a young man of 19, a native of Sopachuy, single, and he is finishing up his high school diploma by studying nights.  Fidel and his mother moved to the tropics four years ago in search of a better life.  His mother bought a small farm where they have planted pineapple and citrus fruits.  This produce covers their expenses, but it is not enough as Fidel wants to study to become a professional.  For this reason, he started night school to complete his diploma so he can next pursue a degree.  Fidel currently rents a room in another town and works as a motorcycle taxi driver during the day, which is why is asking for this loan; he wants to update his work tool by buying a new motorcycle, thereby increasing his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
Chanh is 56 years old, and married with four children. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been running a cafe to sell food and coffee, soft drinks in front of her door for 12 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Chanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks. She will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to sell in her cafe.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 57-year-old married woman. She lives with a daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker of a food factory. She has run a general store at her house for 15 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery, and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitary items.

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family faces.

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, sanitary items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Godson

texts.en: Godson is a married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the agriculture business for twelve years and also operates a retail business to earn additional income.  Pests and price fluctuation affect his yields while his desire is to venture into modern farming.  Godson intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three children, two are adults and one is still in school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has been practicing poultry farming for over two years and she sells to her neighbors and market dwellers. She cites seasonality and diseases as her major challenges.

Josephine is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 48-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at a higher price. Her business is good enough to provide her with a decent life and she has improved her business to meet her day-to-day expenses. For the further improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her two children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Anaid

texts.en:
Anaid is a 50-year-old widow who lives in the village of Majadia with her retired parents. Anaid owns a plot of land where potatoes are grown. She sells the harvest at the local open market, but the income from agriculture is seasonal and the family has no monthly source of income, except for the retirement pensions of Anaid’s parents.

As their existing revenue is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Anaid decided to start a clothing sales business. She requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Anaid’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. She received this credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With this loan of 2000 GEL (Georgia Lari) she will purchase clothing and household items at wholesale prices and resell them in her community door-to-door. It is obvious that the work is hard for Anaid, but she is ready to deal with the vital difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start up a business trading in clothing and household items.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a banker for ten years, and with his salary, he has been able to buy and upgrade his studies. Price fluctuation and stringent working conditions are his major challenges while his dreams are educating his children and venturing into business. Henry is requesting a loan to pay the school fees of his children.

loans.use: To pay the school fees of his children.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 29-year-old man. He has a child who is one year old. He describes himself as jovial.  He operates a retail shop where he sells milk, soap, salt, cooking flour etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as insecurity. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to add stock of milk, bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of milk, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 19-year-old unmarried lady. She is been in business of beauty parlor for one year. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her services she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which will help in generating more income. She dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities for her beauty salon.

loans.name: José Ángel Antonio

texts.es:
Don José posee 41 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador. Actualmente solo tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, que esta estudiando 4° grado en la escuela. Su compañera de vida, tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, ya que sale a vender reliquias a las comunidades cercanas, que celebran algún tipo de fiestas. 

Él en su trabajo, hace doble función, porque maneja y cobra a la vez, trabaja desde hace 3 años en el autobús y su compañera de vida comercializa reliquias desde hace 9 años.

Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, le servirá para consolidar una deuda y además comprara 2 cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.

Su sueño, es ver a sus hijos que se puedan valer por si mismos y tengan una carrera universitaria. Además, quiere en un futuro solicitar un nuevo crédito para construir un casa nueva para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old.  He is a hardworking man.  He currently has only one child, an 11-year-old son who is in the fourth grade.  His life partner has her own source of income as she sells souvenirs in neighboring communities when they celebrate holidays.  

He performs two tasks at work because he drives and charges at the same time.  He has been working at the bus for three years and his life partner has been selling souvenirs for nine years.

With the loan he is requesting he till repay a debt and he will buy two pigs to fatten and later resell.

His dream is to see his children become independent and have college degrees.  He also wants to for another loan in the future to build a new house so his children will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repay a debt and to buy two pigs to fatten and later resell

loans.name: Veronica Janet

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Veronica pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Veronica trabaja como técnica en un laboratorio medica de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que el va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Veronica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho para preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos, ya que la cocina que tiene es a kerosene y su uso es peligroso, asi pues Veronica seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Veronica is 45 years old.  She lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona with her son, whom she loves and who is her main focus in life.  She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts in every effort to get her family ahead.  Thanks to her hard work, Veronica was able to complete the nursing degree she wanted.  

On her own initiative Veronica works as a technician in a medical laboratory in her city.  She works every day for around 10 hours and she believes it is going well because of her skill and dedication.  

Veronica is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will buy a stove, which will greatly help her prepare her foods well, as the stove she has uses kerosene and it is dangerous to use.  Veronica will keep on working and dedicating herself to achieve her greatest dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Jérémie's Group

texts.fr:
Jérémie et ses 2 amis demandent aujourd'hui leur 2ème prêt auprès d'ALIDé. Ils se connaissent depuis longtemps et font partie d'un groupe de Tontine.

Jérémie, le représentant, est marié avec Nathalie, une commerçante, avec laquelle il a eu 3 enfants qui sont actuellement tous scolarisés.

Il exerce le métier de soudeur à son domicile depuis près de 10 ans et est reconnu par ses clients pour sa rapidité et son efficacité.
Aujourd'hui, il demande un second prêt afin de renforcer ses équipements pour mieux répondre au demande de ses clients. Avec les 180,000 CFA il achètera une nouvelle perceuse ainsi qu'un poste portatif de soudure.

En bon père de famille, il souhaite conserver ses bénéfices afin d'acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jérémie and his two friends are currently requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  They have known one another for a long time and are members of a saving's group.

Jérémie, the group's representative, is married to a retailer named Nathalie with whom he has three children who currently all go to school.

Jérémie has been working as a welder, from home, for almost ten years.  His customers appreciate his promptness and efficiency.  This second loan will help him to update his equipment in order to better meet customers' demand.  He will use his share of the loan (180,000 CFA francs) to buy a new drill and a portable welding machine.

Jérémie is a good father who wishes to save his profits in order to buy a plot of land for his children.

loans.use: to buy a drill and a portable welding machine.

loans.name: Jessica Kenelma

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jessica no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado que deseaba.
por iniciativa propia, Jessica trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, Jessica se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Jessica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir para su venta, de esta manera podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 33-year-old woman.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her two young children, whom she loves and who are her main focus in life.  She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts toward getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, a lack of money and the need to work at a very young age prevented Jessica from pursuing the secretarial degree she wanted.

On her own initiative, Jessica works at her small business selling clothing for women, men, and children.  She works every day for around 10 hours.  Jessica is happy doing her work and she believes it is going well for her because of her effort and dedication. 

Jessica is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will buy a greater quantity and a wider variety of clothing to sell, which will allow her to serve more customers.  She will keep working and putting her efforts toward achieving her greatest dream of seeing her children become real professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es un mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Amelia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administratorio de Empresas que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Amelia trabaja comercializando productos agricolas que cultiva en su pequeña parcela, los cuales vende en mercadillos de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas. 
Amelia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de los servicios higiénicos de su hogar, ya que actualmente ella y su familia no cuentan con un baño adecuado, de esta manera Amelia y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Amelia is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her parents in the city of Piura in the district of Jayanca.  She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts toward getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, a lack of money and the need to work from a very young age prevented Amelia from pursuing the business administration degree she wanted.

On her own initiative and with a great deal of hard work and dedication, Amelia works selling the produce she grows on her small plot of land.  She sells them in the small markets in her city.  She works every day starting early in the morning and she can go for around eight hours.  

Amelia is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to install a bathroom in her home because she and her family currently do not have a suitable bathroom.  This will provide Amelia and her family with security and wellbeing.  She will keep working and putting her effort into achieving her greatest dream of expanding her crops.

loans.use: to install a bathroom in her home

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou est un commerçant de bétail qui évolue dans la vente de moutons et de chèvres depuis plus de 10ans. Il habite aux environs du Guichet et il est à son 1er prêt. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter des moutons et des chèvres pour ensuite les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Modou commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19H. Il veut augmenter ses revenus en renforçant ses activités d'embouche et ca grâce à l'aide du guichet. Agé de 41 ans il est marié et père de famille.
texts.en:
Modou is a livestock trader who has been selling sheep and goats for more than ten years.  He lives close to the local branch of the UIMCEC and this is his first loan.  He is requesting a loan to buy some sheep and goats that he will resell at the local weekly markets.

Modou works from 8AM until 7PM.  He wants to boost his livestock fattening activity in order to increase his income, and he plans to do this with the support of the UIMCEC.  He is 41 years old, married, and he has a family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and and goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a moto taxi for her transport business.

loans.name: El Cerro Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios microempresarios exitosos uno de ellos  Brenda mujer de 28 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo menor de edad  de tres años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon en su comunidad desde hace 1 año. Tiene 1 año de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en comprar cosméticos como perfumes de damas y varón, cremas faciales y corporales, lencerías, pinturas de labios, de uñas, cubiertos para el hogar, etc. Maritza mujer de 49 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio y José hombre de 39 años de edad y su negocio es la carpintería, albañil, y agricultura.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Brenda, a 28-year-old woman who has a partner and a three year old little boy. She has been selling Avon cosmetics in her community for the past year. She has been a customer of the institution for one year.

She is asking for the loan to buy cosmetics such as men's and women's fragrance, face and body creams, lingerie, lipstick, nail polish, household covers etc.

Maritza is 49 years old and she runs a small grocery store in her home, while José is 39 and he works as a carpenter and bricklayer and in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as men's and women's fragrance, face creams, body lotions, lingerie, lipstick, nail polish, household covers, etc.

loans.name: La Corona Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Silvia mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 16 años, su negocio es la venta de celulares y recargas en su comunidad desde hace 7 años. Tiene 2 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para comprar celulares más tecnológicos y aumentar su inventario. Jairo hombre de 44 años de edad su negocio es una agencia donde vende gaseosas y Aracely mujer de 34 años de edad y su negocio es el destace de cerdo.
texts.en: The group consists of three partners, all business owners, one of whom is Silvia, who is a 39-year-old single mother who has a 16-year-old son. She has been selling cell phones and top-up cards in her community for more than 7 years. She has been a member of the institution for 2 years. She is requesting the loan to buy more up-to-date cell phones and to increase her stock. Jairo is 44 years old and works selling sodas, and Aracely is 34 years old and works as a pork butcher.

loans.use: to buy more up-to-date cell phones and increase her stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man and has 2 children ages 2 and 6 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a welding shop where he does welding and makes metallic windows, chairs, doors, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are schools, companies and individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more metal bars. His business goal is to open a welding school within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more metal bars.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su compañera de vida y disfruta de un hijo de cinco años de edad, no recibe ayuda del extranjero. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos, crianza de ganado y cerdos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar cuatro reces. Esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar sus utilidades y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño del Sr. José es tener su propia casa
texts.en:
José lives with his partner and has a five year old son. He does not get help from abroad. He works in agriculture, growing bulk grains and rearing cattle and pigs.

With the loan he is asking for he will be able to buy four animals. This investment will help him to increase his profits and improve his quality of life. José's dream is to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy four animals.

loans.name: Ana Dianira

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar trabajando en su negocio de venta de alimentos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar una plancha para la elaboración de pupusas y asi llevar a cabo dicha actividad.
La Sra. Ana cuenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y aportar con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Ana needs a new loan to carry on working in her business selling food. This loan will help her to buy a grill for making pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] to sell. Ana says the previous loan helped her to satisfy her clients' needs and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a grill for making pupusas.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 51 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband support family through the income they earn from their business of selling rice. They have been in this business for two years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dung intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy larger quantities of rice to sell to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of rice to stock and sell at her store.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 37-year-old married lady. She has been involved in the business of hand embroidery for a period of about ten years. She started doing work with her daughters as her husband is a driver by profession and his income is not enough to provide his family alone. Sajida’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery she needs to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 35000 from Kashf foundation. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. 

Sajida dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is 38 years old and is married with two daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as an insurance seller. Tien runs a business of internet services for earning a living. 

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different game cards and other internet facilities to  provide better services for her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy game cards and other internet facilities.

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba.
por iniciativa propia, Johana trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas realizando labores de cosecha, sembrado, riego y otros, ella se siente gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y esfuerzo.
Johana se encentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que con la ayuda brindada construirá una habitación con materiales adecuados y resistentes para su hijo, de esta manera brindará mayor seguridad y bienestar apara su familia, así pues Johana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Johana is 33 years old and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her little son, who she loves and who is the focus of her life. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who puts in a lot of effort to make life better for her family. Unfortunately due to lack of resources she was not able to study for the professional career in education which she wanted. 

On her own initiative, she works as a farm worker at an agricultural farm in her city. She works every day for around 10 hours doing tasks such as harvesting, planting, watering and others. She likes working and thinks things are going well for her because of her determination and hard work. 

Johana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help she gets she will be able to build a room with decent and hard-wearing materials for her son. This will enable her to give her family better security and wellbeing. Johana will continue to work hard to fulfil her biggest dream of seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Madame Daba est une femme mariée et mère de famille qui habite à 8km du guichet. Elle est éleveur de moutons et chèvres. Daba fait cet activité depuis plus de 10ans. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des moutons et des chèvres pour renforcer son cheptel. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l'avenir elle souhaite faire de l'embouche bovine pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle participe dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en: Daba is a married woman and mother who lives about 8 kilometres from the UIMCEC branch. She raises sheep and goats and has been doing this for over 10 years. She needs the loan money so that she can buy some sheep and goats in order to strengthen her herd. She starts her workday at 8am and ends it at 7pm. In future, she would like to fatten cattle so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She participates in the management of the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for raising.

loans.name: Bernadette's Group

texts.fr:
Bernadette, la représentante, a constitué un groupe avec une de ses amies ainsi qu'un membre de sa famille. Ces 3 femmes se connaissent donc très bien et sont des clientes d'ALIDé de longue date, elles en sont à leur 7ème prêt.

Bernadette est mariée avec Félix, qui est maçon, et avec lequel elle a eu 2 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.

Avec ce nouveau prête elle souhaite développer son activité de vente d'Akassa (pate de maïs) et de sucre afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui serviront à continuer à épargner pour acheter une parcelle de terrain.
texts.en: Bernadette, the representative, is in a group with one of her friends and a relative. These 3 women therefore know each other very well and have been customers of ALIDé for a long time. This is their 7th loan. Bernadette is married to Félix who is a builder and with whom she has 2 children who both attend school. With the help of this loan, she hopes to develop her business selling Akassa (a maize paste) and sugar so that she can better satisfy her clientèle. The profits she makes will be used to build up her savings so that she can buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy maize and sugar with which to make Akassa paste.

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Sankaryaar. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes. 
Elle veut s’acheter  04 fus en plastiques, 08douzaines de plats et 02douzaines de carafes.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  s’acheter une parcelle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Binta is the representative of the Ouindinmanegde group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 11 years old and the youngest, 3. 2 of her children go to school. Binta has been selling plastic plates for 5 years. She gets her supplies at the Sankaryaar market. Her customers are women and men. She would like to buy 4 plastic containers, 8 dozen plates and 2 dozen carafes. She wants to save her profits. She aims to buy a plot of land and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 plastic containers, 8 dozen plates and 2 dozen carafes.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Хабиба замужняя женщина. Она  любящая мать троих детей.   С тех пор как вышла замуж они с мужем занимаются откармливанием скота, скот в основном пасется на пастбище, так как они живут в сельской местности. Хабиба имеет несколько внуков и внучек, двое её сыновей работают и живут отдельно, Хабиба старается помочь своим детям, поддерживает их. Когда её старший сын уехал на заработки в Россию, она помогала невестке ухаживать за детьми, потому что тогда её невестка была молодой и неопытной. 
Хабиба хочет увеличить поголовье скота, поэтому обратилась в организацию Арванд, в этом году в горах много травы, поэтому на сумму кредита хочет купить несколько голов скота и откармливать их до зимы. Заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman. She is a loving mother of three children. Since the time when she got married Habiba and her husband have been feeding cattle. The cattle mainly grazes on the pastures as they live in the rural area. Habiba has several grandchildren, two of her sons work and live separately. Habiba tries to help her children and supports them. When her oldest son left for work to Russia she was helping her daughter-in-law to take care of the children because at that time she was young and did not have much experience.

Habiba wants to increase the headcount of cattle and has come to Arvand for this reason. This year there's a lot of grass in the mountains and that's why she wants to use the loan to buy several heads of cattle and feed them until the winter. She is thanking all in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 37 years old, living in the Gori district with her husband, her school-age daughter, and her son who is a soldier. Ekaterine is a cleaner at the local clinic and gets a monthly income. Her spouse is involved in a car-importing business and earns monthly funds as well. The young couple work hard to ensure their children have better living conditions but the existing income is not enough for satisfying their needs. 

Ekaterine decided to start up a clothing sales business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Ekaterine’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. She received this credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 800 USD Ekaterine will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. Her regular customers will be her co-workers and neighbours. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women, and children. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Ekaterine, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing for resale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 35-year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be passionate. Joel is a mason and he builds houses for clients. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. Joel's business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital . He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy building materials like trowels, masons hammers, levels etc. His business goal is to be a contractor within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. Joel also sells cows to earn an extra income.

loans.use: buy building materials like trowels, masons hammers, levels etc

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna de 41 años de edad está casada, es agricultora y ama de casa, tiene un grado de educación primaria completo gracias al apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Ellos tienen 3 hijos y todos viven bajo el mismo techo por lo cual se dividen las tareas y así unos a otros se facilitan y se ayudan en el diario vivir con las diferentes tareas. Ella es agricultora desde hace muchos años siendo sus padres quienes por tradición familiar le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café y en compañía de su pareja lo realiza hace más de 10 años como única fuente de ingresos para su familia. El terreno que en familia trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de su padre y otra comprada con sacrificio y esfuerzo. Esta iniciativa productiva y de desarrollo que realizan a diario, surgió por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos y así lograr una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos. 

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar 12 QQ de fertilizante, 12 QQ de urea y 10 QQ de formula cafetalera con lo cual podrá darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y poder tener una cosecha positiva y esperada.

Su sueño es, ver a sus hijos que se puedan valer por sí mismos y tengan una carrera universitaria, además ampliar más sus cultivos de café para que sus futuros nietos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Reyna, 41 years old, is married, a farmer, and a housewife. She was able to finish primary school thanks to her parents' financial support. She and her husband have three children, and they all live under the same roof. Thus, all family members help each other with daily tasks. Reyna has been a farmer for many years, since it was her parents who, in keeping with family tradition, taught her to till the land. Reyna's speciality is coffee crops, to which she has been tending for over 10 years with her husband's help and which constitute her family's sole source of income. The land they use belongs to them, half thanks to a legacy made by her father, and half bought by the sweat of their brow. The couple embarked on this productive development activity, which provides their daily bread, out of a need to improve their income and thus their children's standard of living. Reyna asked field partner COMIXMUL for a loan in order to buy 12 quintals of fertiliser, 12 quintals of urea, and 10 quintales of coffee-plant growing mixture, which will enable her to tend to her coffee crops and profit from the expected plentiful harvest. Reyna's dream is to see her children become independent and finish university, so that her future grandchildren may enjoy a better life.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 54 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili is a 27-year-old married woman. She has one child. Pili operates a charcoal business and transport service where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inavailability of stock. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a big retail store for charcoal and buy a pick-up within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed in business and life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Naresa

texts.en:
Naresa is 47 years old, married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Naresa has a farming rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Naresa has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 40 years old, married, and supports two people. He runs an Agro-vet store in Kaptumo trading centre. He has been in this business for the last three years, from which he get an average monthly profit of KES 10,000.
Saidi has borrowed a loan of KES 70,000 which he will use to purchase herbicides, pesticides, maize seeds, beans seeds, vegetable seeds and animal drugs for resale. His dream is to expand his business and be able to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the shop such as herbicides, pesticides, maize seeds, beans seeds, vegetable seeds and animal drugs

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey is 24 years old, married to Esther, and blessed with one child aged one and a half years. He provides transport services using his motorbike, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000-20,000. Aggrey has requested a third loan of KES 105,000 to purchase another motorbike. The profit he earns will aid him in repaying his loan and continuing to save. He dreams of owning land and building rental houses for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself as determined. Mary operates a grocery shop where she sells tomatoes, onions, kale, and fruit. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stocks of tomatoes, onions, kale, and fruit. Her business goal is to own a big shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of tomatoes, onions, kale, and fruit

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 48 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pinky is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Pinky has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abbey

texts.en: Abbey is a 49-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming for nine years and also rears cows as additional income. Abbey hopes to expand his farming activities despite challenges of unpredictable weather changes. Abbey intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay workers who are ploughing his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers who are ploughing his garden.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es originaria de Teustepe, tiene 53 años de edad, casada y madre de 9 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace seis años. Esta agradecida con Kiva  y MiCredito por la oportunidad que le han brindado con el préstamo ya que pudo invertir en sus cosechas y adquirir mayores ingresos. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar insumos tales como: abono, fertilizantes, urea, gasolina entre otros con el fin de tener buena cosecha para comercializar su producto. Su meta futuro es comprar ganado para obtener mayores ingresos. su meta proxima es cosechar mas y pagar el prestamo, ella desea seguir teniendo el apoyo de kiva para salir adelante y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is from Teustepe. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She has been working in agriculture for the past six years. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for the opportunity that they have given her with the loan, since she is now able to invest in her crops and increase her income. She is applying for this new loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea and fuel, among other things, with the intention of having a good harvest to sell. 

In the future she would like to buy livestock to increase her earnings. Her next goal is to have a larger harvest and pay back the loan. She hopes to continue to have the support that Kiva provides to be able to get by and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertliizers, urea and fuel, among other things.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 39 year old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a carpentry store where he makes sofa sets, chairs, stools etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase timber, leather, nails and other materials for making furniture. His business goal is to open another branch within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a welding workshop. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: purchase timber, leather, nails and other materials for making furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Abdilia, trabaja mucho para poder sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es que sus condiciones de vida puedan mejorar, su esposo esta apoyandola siempre en todo y con los gastos del hogar, el trabaja por cuenta propia desempeñandose como Albañil, ella tiene su negocio de Venta de Ropa Usada, sus hijos por su parte ya son independiente pero siempre ayudan en el hogar. Gracias a este4 credito podra invertir en su negocio y sus gananacias mejoraran en gran manera. Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindando
texts.en:
Abdilia works very hard to get by and to help her family get by.  Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions.  

Her husband always helps with everything and with the household expenses.  He is self-employed and works as a mason.  She has her own business selling used clothing.  Her children are independent adults but they also always help with the household expenses.  

Thanks to this loan, she will be able to invest in her business and her income will grow.  She is thankful for the help and support that Afodenic and Kiva are providing to her.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix de 50 años está casado con Esther con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Félix es un hombre organizado y trabajador. Se dedica a ala agricultura hace más de 20 años. Cuenta con 3 héctareas de terrenos, en cada una de ellas siembra café, cacao y achiote. La producción de estos 3 productos son más rentables, pero su cosecha es anual. Él cultiva sus campos de tal manera que coincidan las fechas de cosechas en meses donde sus gastos son mayores; por ejemplo, el café lo cosecha en mayo y junio; el cacao en abril, mayo y junio; y el achiote en octubre y noviembre. Así no le falta dinero, para invertir en otras siembras. Éste es su tercer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Félix, invertirá S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Félix is 50 years old. He is married to Esther, with whom he has 6 children, but he only lives with 2 of them in his own house. Félix is an organized and hardworking man. He has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. He has 3 hectares of land and on each he plants coffee, cacao and annato. The production of these 3 products are profitable, but his harvest is annual. He cultivates his fields in such a way that the harvests coincide with the months he has the most expenses. For example, he harvests the coffee in May and June, the cacao in April, May and June, and the annato in October and November. That way, he doesn't lack for money to invest in other crops. This is his third loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he is getting to get ahead. He is also committed to making his payments on time. Félix will invest the S/.1000 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 40-year-old single mother of three children aged 18, 12 and 9 years, respectively. She owns a retail shop, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She has requested for a first loan of 50,000 KES to purchase bales of flour, bags of rice and sugar, detergent and soap. The profit she earns will aid her in repaying her loan and diversifying her business. Her dream is to see this business expand.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour, bags of rice and sugar, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Marina tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde joven a atravesado por momentos difíciles y ello le ha dado más fuerzas para luchar, actualmente marina trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante cada día porque es responsable.
Marina está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá solventar los gatos para el trámite del título de propiedad de un pequeño terreno que acaba de comprar con mucho esfuerzo, de esta manera tendrá los documentos en regla y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad el sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marina is 32 years old and lives in the city of Ica. She has a great drive to get on in life. Since being young she has gone through some difficult times and this has given her a lot of determination. Currently Marina works as a farm worker in an agricultural farm in her city and with the income she earns she is able to help her parents with the household expenses. She believes she is making progress all the time because she is responsible.

Marina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their great support she will be able to cover the paperwork costs to process the property title for a small piece of land which she has just bought after a great deal of hard work. In this way she will have the documentation in order and will be able to carry on working towards making her dream of having her own house a reality.

loans.use: to cover the paperwork costs to process a property title.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry tiene  27  años de edad, esta soltero y vive con los padres  actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja…
texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old, he is single, and he lives with his parents.  With this loan he will buy supplies such as fertilizer, fumigants, and he will hire someone to help him with the work.  He works hard to maintain his crops so that they are always healthy and so that he doesn't miss out on any production.  

With his coffee crops, he will be able to earn a higher income and contribute to the family's expenses.  He currently does not have the capital he needs to buy these supplies as he has minimal resources and no way to borrow the necessary money.  This is why he is seeking a loan.  

This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He has never had previous loans with any other bank, but Fudecosur has provided him with this loan with good terms and with a low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 40 years old and she lives with her mother in Yerevan. She has a degree in pedagogy, and for several years she has worked at the school as an English language teacher, but over time she became engaged in a trading business, in which her mother helps her very much. From time to time she has some orders for translations; this provides an alternative source of income for her small family. She has her trading business occupation in a rented stall in Yerevan's  wholesale market. She sells women's clothes, bags and shoes. She imports all these products from China and Turkey once a month. 

Overall, Kristine is satisfied with the income of her business, but she needs money to purchase clothes for the upcoming new autumn/winter season. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD for that purchase. Her previous Kiva loan was of great use for her, and she hopes very much that this one will also be profitable.

loans.use: to buy and transport autumn and winter clothes to resell.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 49 years old and married. She has five children.
Susanita earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Susanita has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store and by farming rice.
