She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene  49  años de edad, esta casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos  actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones de chile , para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto de chile  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja…
texts.en: Jorge is a married man of 49 who currently lives with his wife and two children.  He intends to use the loan to buy supplies such as manure and fumigant and, in turn, employ a workforce to help him. He will tend his chilli crops to avoid them being damaged and resulting in lost production.  His chilli business will, therefore, generate more income for his family, as their income is low and he has no other means of obtaining the money.  For this reason, he applied for a loan - his first from FUDECOSUR.  He had not previously had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him one with better facilities and a much lower interest rate...

loans.use: to tend his chilli crop

loans.name: Rosa Veronica

texts.es:
Rosa, vive en casa propia, tiene 26 años de edad y disfruta de tres hijos. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura, ya que posee una granja de pollos para obtener ingresos y así salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, dicha actividad la aprendio por iniciativa propia y el negocio lo tiene en la casa por lo que no tiene horario establecido, desde hace un año lo desempeña.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar pollos, concentrado y vitaminas. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar el número de pollos y el insumo necesario el mantenimiento; también fortalecer el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de la Sra. Rosa es optimizar su situación económica para financiar la educación de sus hijos y que ellos puedan tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old, has three children and lives in her own house. She works in agriculture and has a chicken farm to generate income so she can meet the household running costs. She started the business up a year ago on her own initiative and since it is in her home she does not have fixed hours of work.

The loan she is asking for will enable her to buy chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins. The money will help her to increase the number of chickens and the necessary supplies for their development as well as strengthening the business and improving her income. Rosa's dream is to improve her economic situation so she can finance her children's education and so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, está acompañado y vive en casa propia,  tiene 53 años de edad y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 24 y 28 años de edad. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos y a la ganadería, dicho oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y lleva 23 años de trabajar en lo propio, lo desempeña de 6:00am a 12:00pm.
El Sr. Juan solicita el préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono. Esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la capacidad de inversión con el crédito, incrementar sus ingresos y fortalecer el negocio.
Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica para adquirir una vida mejor con su familia y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is married and lives in his own home. He is 53 years old and has two children, aged 24 and 28. He works in agriculture, planting basic grains, and also raises cattle. He learned this work from his parents and has been working on his own for 23 years. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. 

Juan is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials, such as herbicide, pesticide, insecticide and fertilizer. This investment will help him increase his investment capacity and his income, fortifying his business. His dream is to improve his financial situation to acquire a better life with his family and grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 31-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as aggressive in business. He operates a business transporting customers using his rickshaw. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are daily travelers. He describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts to service the rickshaw. His business goal is to be stable and successful within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his rickshaw.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 27 years old, married, and blessed with a child who is two years and a half. He owns a general store where he sells a variety of goods. He started this business three years ago and earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. He has requested a second loan of 100,000 KES to purchase bed covers, mattresses, bed sheets, bags, and curtains. The profit he earns will help him expand this business and repay his loan. He hopes to see his business grow into a supermarket. He also hopes to see his family lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase bed covers, mattresses, bed sheets, bags, and curtains

loans.name: Fidencio Elpidio

texts.es:
Fidencio, vive con su esposa y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 2 y 5 años, todos dependen de él. Se dedica a la artesanía y asimismo a la jarcia, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am en adelante.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar petates, entre otros, para luego comercializarlo. Esta inversión le ayudara a cubrir la demanda de los clientes, ya que la temporada es  favorable.
Su sueño es ofrecerle el estudio a sus hijos siempre.
texts.en:
Fidencio lives with his wife and two children aged 2 and 5 years who all depend on him. He earns a living making crafts and "jarcia" [rope made from agave fibre], skills which he learnt from his parents. He works every day from 6 o'clock in the morning.

The loan he is asking for will enable him to buy "petates" [handwoven bedrolls] and other items to then sell. The funds will allow him to meet the demands of his customers, given that the current conditions are favourable. His dream is to always be able to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to buy "petates" [handwoven bedrolls] and other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 10 years and 15 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells toothpaste, washing soap, etc. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of toothpaste, washing soap, cooking oil, etc. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of toothpaste, washing soap, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 38-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself as experienced. He operates a transport business where he owns a vehicle for carrying passengers from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy spare parts for the motor vehicle. His business goal is to be independent within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Druscillah

texts.en: Druscillah is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, salt, flour, and other household products. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add to her stock of sugar, salt, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to add to her stock.

loans.use: to add to her stock of sugar, salt, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es una mujer de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eusebia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Eusebia se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene un pequeño cultivo de plátano y frutas de su regio, adicionalmente Eusebia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar y plastiquería en general, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Eusebia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar una refrigeradora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder conservar adecuadamente sus alimentos y en la época de verano desea vender gaseosas, helados y otros, de esta manera podrá tener mayores ingresos económicos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener a su familia unidad.
texts.en: Eusebia is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the city of Aguaytia with her three beloved children, who are her reason for living  She is a very cheerful, hardworking and enthusiastic person who gives her all to support her family.  Unfortunately, because her family was short of money and she had to work from a very young age, Eusebia did not have the chance to study for a career.  She works in agriculture, farming a small crop of bananas and other local fruits and, in addition, runs a small shop selling household and general plastic goods.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes that her businesses are doing well due to her dedication and hard work.  Eusebia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their help, she will be able to buy a fridge, which will be very useful in enabling her to preserve her food properly and sell soft drinks, ice creams etc. in the summer.  As a result, her income will increase, enabling her to carry on working and striving to achieve her great ambition of keeping her family together.

loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Nelli Tolentina

texts.es:
Nelli es una mujer de 64 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Nelli no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba.
por iniciativa propia, Nelli trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Nelli se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes y bebidas,de esta manera tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzando se para lograr su gran sueño de de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nelli is 64 years old and live in the city of Huaraz, in the district of Carhuaz, with her son who she loves and who is the main focus of her life. She is a friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts in a lot of effort to make life better for her family. Unfortunately due to lack of resources and needing to work from a young age she was not able to study for the professional career in education which she wanted. Working on her own initiative, Nelli runs a small grocery store. She works for around 10 hours every day and believes things are going well for her because of her hard work and determination. 

Nelli is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since the help she is given enables her to buy a larger quantity of groceries and drinks. By doing this she will keep her business better stocked and serve more customers. She will carry on working hard to achieve her biggest dream of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a 40-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for 13 years and also practices agriculture to earn extra income. Low salary and price fluctuations are her major challenges, while her dream is to educate her children up to the University. Asha is requesting money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 43 years old. He and his family live in Stepanavan in Lori Province. Hakob has a higher education; he graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural Institute. He is married, and he has three children – two sons and a daughter. Hakob works as an engineer. Together with his retired parents in the village of Bovadzor, Hakob is simultaneously engaged in farming and beekeeping. Hakob’s parents are very skilled at beekeeping, and, together, they all manage to have a perfect pure honey, which they sell at the Stepanavan food markets. They also breed two cows and calves.
Hakob plans to enlarge the quantity of his bee families, and he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy several bee families. He also wants to buy some animal feed.

loans.use: to enlarge the quantity of his bee families and to buy some animal feed

loans.name: Kamau

texts.en:
Kamau is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 25 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the 80,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a dairy cow. He also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a green grocery where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable place, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to grow. 

She will use the 10,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of onions, tomatoes, kale and other products. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of onions, tomatoes, kale and other products.

loans.name: Ndiogou

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiogou est un homme de 50ans qui évolue dans l'embouche bovine. Il a une expérience de plus de 15ans dans cet activité. Il est marié et père de famille. Ndiogou demande ce prêt pour pouvoir acheter des bœufs les élever et ensuite les revendre. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Il souhaite augmenter son cheptel et satisfaire la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiogou, age 50, practices cattle fattening. He has over 15 years of experience in this activity. He is married with children. 

Ndiogou is seeking this loan to buy oxen that he will raise and sell. His typical day begins at 9 A.M. and ends at 8 P.M. 

His goals are to increase his herd and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy oxen for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 44-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for one year, and she also practices farming to earn additional income. As a good mother, she desires to educate her children up to the university level and to expand her business, despite her low capital base. Susan is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.name: Kamulikwizi Women Group

texts.en:
Robert is a 43-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electronics for 17 years and also offers the service of installing them in houses so as to earn additional income. He started the business in order to raise money for his growing family and has since reaped tangible benefits. Bad debtors and inadequate capital are his major setbacks, while is goal is to trade in wholesale. 

Robert intends to use the loan to buy electronic appliances to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group, in which each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy electronic appliances to sell.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora Ana forma parte desde hace 5 años del grupo de crédito Siempre Amigas, le gusta este grupo por la unión que existe entre todas, la solidaridad y el compañerismo, además que los créditos le permiten mejorar su negocio y continuar creciendo. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene varios lugares para visitar tantos naturales como arquitectónicos, su gente aún conservan su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Ana tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijas, dos de ellas son casadas y viven independientes, su hija soltera trabaja para sus gastos personales. Su esposo se dedica a la fabricación de jeans, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Ana se dedica a la venta de jeans que con su marido confeccionan y también vende una gran variedad de ropa, su mercadería vende en todas las ferias de la ciudad, en este negocio se encuentra desde hace 30 años. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
For 5 years Ana has been a member of the credit group Siempre Amigas [Always Friends]. She likes the group because of the unity, solidarity and companionship there is between all the women and because the loans allow her to improve her business and continue growing. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, a city which was designated a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  It has various sites of interest to visit, both natural and architectural. The people still preserve their culture and traditions.

Ana is 52 years old and is married with 3 daughters. Two of them are married and live independently and her single daughter works to cover her own personal expenses. Ana's husband makes jeans for a living and they live in their own home.

Ana earns a living selling the jeans which her husband makes and also sells a wide variety of clothing. She sells her merchandise in all the city's fairs and has been in this business for 30 years.

She will use the loan to buy clothing. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 26 years old. He is married to Alice and they are blessed with one child, aged 5 years. He supports the two people in his family. 

Alexander is a motorcycle spare parts dealer in Kapsabet. He has been in this business for the last three years. From this business he get a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES 73,000 that he will use to buy different motorcycle spare parts such as headlights, tyres, friction discs and silicon rubber parts.

He anticipates profits that he will use it to repay his loan as well as improve his living standards. His dream is to be a successful businessman and expand his business to other towns.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Khemesse

texts.fr: Madame Khémesse est un cultivateur de profession qui habite à 5km du Guichet. Avec l'hivernage elle veut acheter des semences pour cultiver son champs. Elle fait ca depuis plus de 15ans. Khémesse est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l'avenir elle veut faire de l'embouche ovine pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Ensuite elle voudrait être pérenne pour ne plus avoir besoin des crédits du Guichet. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khémesse is a farmer by trade. She lives 5 km from the local U-IMCEC branch. With the rainy season coming, she wants to buy seeds to cultivate her field. She has been practicing this activity for over 15 years. Her typical workday starts at 8 A.M. and ends at 6 P.M. Khémesse is married with children, and she helps her husband with the daily expenditures and the children’s tuition fees. 

In the future, she would like to start sheep fattening to bolster her revenue and improve her family’s living conditions. She wants to achieve sustainability in her activity and not have to rely on micro-financing.

loans.use: to buy seeds to cultivate her field.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita,  tiene 22 años de edad, soltera,  tiene una  hija dependiente, se dedica a la actividad económica de cultivo de maní, frejol y papa con el objetivo de dar una buena alimentación y educación a su hijita de 2 añitos, quien  por motivos de fuerza mayor no pudo llevar adelante la relación familiar con el padre de su hija por tanto decidió vivir sola, tiene a sus padres quienes le colaboran en la producción agrícola. Por las crecidas del rio que bordea su propiedad ha sufrido el desborde que causó un daño a los cultivos de maní y frejol, quedando anegados de lodo y otros materiales, esto ocasiono una disminución de sus ingresos económicos, además del desborde del rio las heladas del mes de junio afectaron a los cultivos de papa dejándole en condiciones muy desfavorables; por todo lo anteriormente mencionado la estabilidad económica de la señora Benita ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de los materiales e insumos requeridos para la producción agrícola y  la canasta familiar, para la alimentación de la familia. Para enmendar lo mencionado anteriormente ha recurrido al crédito con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida y estabilizar las necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Benita, 22, is single and has a dependent daughter, 2.  She makes a living growing peanuts, beans, and potatoes so she can feed and educate her young daughter.  For reasons beyond her control, she wasn't able to continue the family relationship with the father of her daughter, so she decided to live alone.  Her parents help her with the agricultural work.

When the river that borders her property rose, a flood of mud and other materials damaged her peanut and bean crops, causing her income to drop.  In addition to the rise in the river, freezes in June affected her potato crop, leaving it in very unfavorable conditions.

For all these reasons Benita's economic stability has suffered, directly affecting her acquisition of the materials and inputs she needs for her agricultural work and to feed her family.

To rectify this she has requested a loan so she can improve her quality of life and stabilize her economic needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and inputs

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito  Libertad en Progreso está conformado por 11 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, hay grandes llanuras propicias para la crianza de ganado, sus tierras son fértiles ideales para la siembra de una gran variedad de verduras y hortalizas. Su gente son personas amables, gentiles, que luchan el día a día para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y así sacar adelante a sus familias, a pesar del tiempo aun guardan su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmen Lucia,  a ella le gusta esta forma de créditos por la unión y compañerismo de las socias y porque le ayudan a mejorar su estabilidad económica.

Doña Carmen Lucia tiene 50 años, es soltera y no ha concebido hijos, vive con sus padres a quienes les ayuda y comparte los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Carmen Lucia se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, ovejas, cuyes y ganado del cual vende la leche, también siembra y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. 

El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros, semillas y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: The Libertad en Progreso credit group is made up of 11 women who live in and around the parish of Victoria del Portete in Cuenca.  It is a region which enjoys a cold climate and has vast plains perfect for cattle rearing and fertile soils ideal for growing a wide range of fruit and vegetables. The local people are cheerful and kind and strive on a daily basis to have increasingly stable households and, as a result, help their families make progress.  In spite of the passage of time, they still uphold their culture and traditions.  On of the group members is Carmen Lucia who likes this form of loan on account of the sense of unity and companionship among the members and because they help her to improve her financial stability.  Carmen Lucia is a single woman of 50 who has no children and lives with her parents, helping them and sharing the household expenses.  She breeds animals such as hens, sheep, guinea pigs and cattle whose milk she then sells.  She also grows crops, some of which are consumed by her family and the rest sold.  She will use the money from the loan to buy manure to improve her pasture land, as well as seeds and animal feed.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and animal feed

loans.name: Rosa Targelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa se encuentra desde hace 13 años en el grupo de crédito Siempre Amigas, en todo este tiempo ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas las integrantes, a mas que los créditos otorgados le han beneficiado en su hogar. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que está rodeado de verdes campos y una belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad, son personas amables, gentiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, dos de ellos son casados, uno de ellos vive independiente y su otro hijo casado vive en su casa pero comparte los gastos del hogar, una hija trabaja para solventar sus gastos, uno de sus hijos estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Rosa es comerciante informal y se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, en este negocio se encuentra desde hace 15 años, su mercadería vende los días de ferias. En su casa se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos y cuyes, también siembra y lo que cosecha  es para el consumo de su hogar.

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa de niños. 

Su meta es ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the Siempre Amigas [Always Friends] credit group for 13 years. In that time she has developed a strong friendship with all of the other members as well as getting loans which have helped her in her household. She lives on the outskirts of the Valle de Cuenca parish, a place which is surrounded by green fields and natural beauty. The locals earn a living from rearing animals and in agriculture or many of them work in the city. They are friendly and helpful people who still keep up the traditions and culture instilled by their parents.

Rosa is 55 years old and is married with 6 children. Two of her sons are married; one lives independently and the other lives in her house but shares the household costs. One daughter works to cover her expenses, one son is at university and the two remaining sons are studying at school. Rosa's husband is an industrial mechanic and works in his own workshop. They own the house which they live in.

Rosa is a casual trader selling children's clothing. She has been doing this for 15 years and sells her merchandise on market days. At home she rears cattle, pigs and guinea pigs as well as growing crops for her own household's consumption.

She will use the loan to buy children's clothing. Her goal is to extend her home.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Purification successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Purification's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that enabled her improve her weaving and roof thatch business using palm leaves.

With the loan of KES 10,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase palm leaves to support her mat weaving and roof thatch business. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves to support her mat weaving and roof thatch business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 36-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.

For 14 years she has been serving as a teacher and with her salary savings, she has been able to buy land for farming. Low salary and unpredictable weather changes are her major challenges while her dream is to expand her farming activities. 

Sarah intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that enabled her to get more profits. She used the loan money to add more foods to her business. Now, she is requesting a new loan of KES10,000 to purchase rice, beans, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells children's and ladies' clothing in Npatado (near Takoradi). She has been working in this enterprise for 4 years now. She was educated till the end of senior high school. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a constructor. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her clothing enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esther Galud

texts.es:
La Señora Esther se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Siempre Amigas desde hace 3 años, en todo este tiempo gracias a los créditos ha logrado mejorar su negocio y a su vez  establecer una mejor amistad con todas sus vecinas y amigas. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que está rodeado de verdes campos y una belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad, son personas amables, gentiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres.

La Señora. Esther tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo tiene 15 años y estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Esther se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, actividad que aprendió por habilidad y lleva en el negocio 14 años. También se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y la agricultura.

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener un taller grande de confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Esther has been in the Siempre Amigas communal bank for three years.  In all of this time, thanks to the loans, she has managed her business.  She has also managed to establish a better friendship with all of her neighbors and friends.  She lives on the outskirts of the Valle parish in Cuenca.  The place is surrounded by green fields and a natural beauty.  Its people devote themselves to raising animals and farming.  Many of them work in the city.  They are kind and gentle people who still maintain the culture and traditions instilled in them by their parents.

Esther is a 49 year old widow.  However, they did have four children.  Three of them are married and live independently.  Her last child is 15, and he attends school in the city.  She lives in her own house.

Esther makes clothing, which she learned by her skill.  She has been in the business for 14 years.  She also raises guinea pigs and farms.

She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, and feed for the animals.

Her goal is to have a large clothes making shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that enabled her to increase the stock in her grocery store.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase vegetables and sacks of potatoes, onions, rice and beans for her business.

She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and sacks of potatoes, onions, rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is a 56-year-old woman with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations are her major challenges, while her dream is to venture into mechanized agriculture. Kellen intends to use the loan to plant more maize.

loans.use: to plant more maize.

loans.name: George William

texts.en: George William is a 50-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming, alongside earning a salary as a civil servant. He has a vision of diversifying his farming to include a tea plantation, although he is facing the hardship of unpredictable weather changes. He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, decide optar por un nuevo préstamo porque los créditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos para la agricultura y cualquier otra actividad; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. 
Con el crédito anterior menciona el Sr. Juan que logro adquirir la producción de granos básicos y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Juan has decided to apply for a new loan as they are a source of income for agriculture or any other type of business.  This investment will enable him to buy the agricultural supplies he needs, such as: manure, weed-killer, pesticides and insecticide, among other things.  Juan says that his previous loan allowed him to start growing basic grains and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed-killer, pesticides and insecticide, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for part of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for part of the secondary school tuition of his daughter, Barwaaqo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his daughter's tuition for the year at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her daughter's secondary school tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her daughter's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his daughter's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells hair extensions and wigs in Npatado (near Takoradi). She was educated through middle school. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is farmer. Mary has been working in this enterprise for 3 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her hair extension and wig enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to extend her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: Ndèye est une brave femme qui est agée de 44ans. Mariée elle est mère de famille qui évolue dans l'élevage des moutons. Elle a une expérience de plus de 8ans dans cet activité. Madame Ndèye sollicite ce montant pour acheter des moutons enfin de renforcer son cheptel. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes de la famille. A l'avenir elle souhaite augmenter son fonds de roulement et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en diversifiant son cheptel.
texts.en:
Ndèye, age 44, is a brave woman who is married with children. She practices sheep fattening and has over 8 years of experience in this activity. 

Ndèye is seeking a loan to buy sheep and increase her herd. She helps her husband with the household’s day-to-day expenses. 

In the future, she wants to bolster her working capital and improve her family’s living conditions by diversifying her livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that helped her support her saloon business, thus gaining more profits that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase weaves, braids and shampoo for her salon business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase weaves, braids, and shampoo for her salon business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 34-year-old man, married with four children and living in Hoima, Uganda. He runs a produce business dealing in maize, beans and groundnuts, which he has operated for a period of two years now. He earns additional income from his bar and through farming. His dream is to buy a lorry for transporting his merchandise, yet he is facing the challenges of limited capital and unpredictable weather changes. Alex  intends to use the loan to buy produce such as maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en:
Nason is a long-time client in the institution, having taken more than four loans from Ishaka Branch. He is a married man with 11 children and two dependents who are orphans. Three of his children are of school-going age and are in school at the moment. 

His major source of income is tea growing, which he has done since 2000 in the outskirts of Ishaka. He started tea growing to be able to have a steady source of income in order to pay the school fees for his children. 

Nason is a very hardworking man and he has seen the business grow steadily since 2000. In addition to tea growing he also trades in goats to be able to supplement the income from tea growing. His major challenge is unpredictable weather that affects the yields negatively. 

Nason would like to use the UGX 1,200,000 to buy fertilizers so that he harvests much more than the usual quantities, gets more income and hence has more financial stability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses, 26, is a businessman. He is a new client and has applied for a loan of  1,200,000 UGX to help boost his retail business. He started the retail business in 2003 in a rural setting, but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. His customers are the people in his local area and their continued support and his tireless efforts have helped his business grow. He started this business to be able to have a source of income and in the long run to able to look after his children. The major challenge in his business is price fluctuation, but he hopes to have this challenge solved with the loan money, which will allow him to buy in bulk.

loans.use: to buy stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a hardworking man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is tea planting, and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university. He also wants to expand his tea plantation despite facing the hardship of unpredictable weather changes. Richard intends to use the loan to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
After graduating primary school, Abena decided to set up her own ‘Wakye’ selling business (Wakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She prepares her ‘Wakye’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Npatodo (near Cape Coast). With over four years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye’. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a plumber) with the upkeep of their house, while also ensuring that their five  children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye’

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Santo Tomas es un grupo muy trabajador, que está luchando por salir adelante, e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Todas ellas son muy luchadoras y emprendedoras que quieren salir adelante. Una de ellas es Melania, quien hace artesanías en barro.
Es una persona con mucho talento ya que sus artesanías son bien vendidas y a sus clientes les gusta mucho. Es una persona con grande visión y cuenta que esta trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus artesanías, para que así siga trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos. Quiere comprar arcilla, pinturas y demás.
texts.en: The Santo Tomas group is made up of members who are very hardworking and who strive to make progress and improve their living conditions.  They are all very determined and enterprising and share the desire to make progress.  One of them is Melania, who makes clay handicrafts.  She is highly talented and her handicrafts sell well and are well liked by her customers.  She is a forward thinking person and says that she is working to help her family.  She is applying for the loan to invest in her handicrafts and, as a result, carry on working and striving to improve her income.  She wants to buy clay, paint and other items.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint and other items.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La Señora Nilda es una persona muy trabajadora, es dueña de un  copetín comedor, el cual esta ubicado en una zona muy populosa, su local está muy bien ubicada,  ya que tiene muy buena clientela gracias a eso. Hace como 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y cada vez le va mejor.
 Ella tiene un hijo, el cual gracias a su sacrificio y esfuerzo está estudiando una carrera universitaria, y quiere que el día de mañana el sea una persona de bien y pueda ayudar a las personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la renovación de sus muebles, como ser sillas, mesas, utensilios y demás, que le será de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Nilda is a very hardworking person. She is the owner of a snack bar and restaurant that is located in a very busy area. Her shop is very well located, and thanks to that, she has a very good clientele. She has been running this business for about nine years and it is going better for her all the time. 

She has one son who is studying toward a university degree, thanks to her efforts and sacrifices. She wants for him to one day be a person of means who will be able to help others. 

She is requesting this loan so she can invest in the upgrade of her furnishings, like chairs, tables, utensils, and more; this will be a great help for her to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings, like chairs, tables, utensils, and more.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates the previous loan she received from Kiva that enabled her to add more stock in her grocery store, thus generating more profits that she used to improve her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, soap and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, soap and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Estrella inician el 6to ciclo son mujeres jefas de familia que se pudieron como meta crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo profesional.
Una persona digna de destacar es la directora del grupo la Sra. Blanca, quien es una persona muy carismática que sabe motivar a su grupo animándolas a seguir trabajando y luchando por salir adelante e ir mejorando sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Blanca se dedica a la costura y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, y así seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes e invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Estrella" [New Star] is beginning its sixth cycle, and is made up of women who are the heads of their families.  These women have goals to not only grow economically, but also professionally.

The woman being highlighted is the director of the group.  Her name is Blanca, and she is a very charismatic person.  She knows how to motivate a group and to make people excited about working, fighting to get ahead, and improving their incomes and quality of life.

Blanca makes a living in sewing.  She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.  In doing this, she will be able to continue complying with the demand of her customers and investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Charllo

texts.en:
Charllot is married and has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. Although she has received no prior formal education, Charllot is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling  smoked fish in Npatado near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for two years.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Charllot is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fish to smoke, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Charllot  plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase fish to smoke.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
After graduating  primary school, Patricia decided to set up her own Kenkey selling business (Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves).  She prepares her Kenkey on her own and sells it in Npatado (near Takoradi). 

With over eight years worth of experience, Patricia is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty Kenkey. She plans to  use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a farmer, with the upkeep of their house and ensure that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase maize.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice appreciates the previous loan she got from Kiva that enabled her to get more profits in her cafe business, which improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase beans, rice, sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour for her cafe business. 

She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour for her cafe business.

loans.name: Luz Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny, con 41 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Aprendió las labores del campo desde que era joven, debido a que es allí donde ha vivido siempre. Gracias a esto y a las enseñanzas de sus padres, se dedica a criar ganado lechero, cuya producción se utiliza para elaborar y vender quesos y el líquido como tal; de esta forma obtiene los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, pujante, activa; ni la necesidad económica, ni la falta de oportunidades de empleo la detuvieron para seguir luchando y progresar. 
Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más ganado (vaca productora de leche), con el fin de aumentar su producción para poder satisfacer la demanda de los productos y así tener mejores ingresos. Esto le permitirá seguir ayudando con las obligaciones económicas del hogar y además podrá seguir invirtiendo  en su negocio para obtener más vacas y, poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fanny is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She learned agricultural work starting when she was young, because she has always lived in the country. Thanks to this and what her parents taught her, she now works raising dairy cattle, and she uses their milk to make and sell cheeses and other dairy products. From this work she earns enough income to help her husband with household expenses. The field partner says that Fanny is tenacious, strong and active, and that neither economic necessity nor a lack of employment opportunities has stopped her from continuing to fight to get ahead.

Fanny is requesting this loan to buy more dairy cattle. Her goal is to increase her production to satisfy the demand for her products and therefore increase her income. She says this will allow her to continue helping with household expenses and to continue investing in her business buy increasing the size of her herd. Little by little she hopes to continue improving her family’s living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cattle.

loans.name: John Jairo De Jesús

texts.es:
John, a sus 34 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 5 y 6 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde joven, aprendió se dedica a la labores agrícolas, pues su padre le enseñó. Actualmente vive en una parcela arrendada y allí posee cultivos de papa criolla, fríjol y arveja, productos que son cosechados y vendidos en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside. Para complementar sus ingresos, alterna el cuidado de sus cultivos, trabajando por días como jornalero, en fincas vecinas. Así logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar y llevar el alimento diario a su familia. 
John es un hombre luchador, pujante, trabajador, a pesar de las adversidades y obstáculos que se le presentan, él siempre encuentra la forma de sobrepasarlos y seguir avanzando; su mayor desafío es costear los insumos necesarios para el cuidado de sus cultivos, pues son bastante costosos, adicionalmente ha tenido algunas dificultades porque el precio de venta de la cosecha es muy variable e inestable. Esta es la razón por la que solicita el crédito, pues será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fungicidas, fertilizantes y semillas, con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio, ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, así podrá sacar una cosecha con productos de mejor calidad para ser vendidos a mejor precio en el mercado, aumentando así el margen de ganancias. Esto le ayudará a cumplir el sueño de poder ampliar sus cultivos a mediano plazo y tener una estabilidad económica favorable, que le permita brindar una excelente educación a sus hijos y disfrutar con su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
John, 34, is a father to two children, ages 5 and 6. He lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. From a young age, he learned about farm work from his father. He currently lives on a rented plot of land where he grows potatoes, beans, and peas. He harvests the crops and sells them in the marketplace in his municipality. To complement his earnings, he alternates the maintenance of his own crops with work as a daily laborer on neighboring farms. He is then able to cover his household necessities and bring home the daily bread to his family.

John is a fighter and a strong, hardworking man. Despite the adversities and obstacles that come up, he always finds a way to face them and continue moving forward. His greatest challenge is paying for the supplies he needs to take care of his crops, because they are quite expensive. He has also had some problems because the price of his harvest is variable and unstable.

Therefore, he has applied for a loan to invest in the purchase of farm supplies such as manure, fungicides, fertilizer, and seeds to continue with his business, which has become his main source of income. He will then be able to produce a better-quality harvest and sell his crops at a higher price in the marketplace, increasing his profit margin. This will help him to accomplish his dream of expanding his crops in the medium term and having favorable financial stability, which will allow him to give his children an excellent education and enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as manure, fungicides, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy produce to sell.

loans.name: Sandro

texts.en:
Sandro has always dreamt of becoming a professional. To achieve his goal, Sandro has enrolled in the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier. He plans on graduating in March, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Sandro plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Sandro feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Sandro currently works 30 hours a week and earns $20 a day. With a degree in business he expects to earn $25 a day. 

Sandro's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of seven, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of 4, with one older sibling attending college already, Sandro is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Sandro's father works as a taxi driver and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Sandro hopes to be able to contribute towards his family's income in the near future. To help afford his school and living expenses, Sandro currently works as an independent contractor.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika has always dreamt of becoming a professional. She is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in business. She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With this loan, Erika plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them Erika hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

Erika currently works 30 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a degree in business she expects to earn $15 a day. Erika's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of five, finances have always been tight. With two younger sisters, Erika hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university. 

Erika's father works as a mechanic and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Erika hopes to be able to contribute towards her family's income in the near future. Erika currently works as a kitchen assistant to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Cinthia Roxana

texts.en:
Cinthia dreams of becoming a professional. To achieve her goal, Cinthia has enrolled in the Universidad Privada Domingo Savio. She expects to graduate in December, 2013 but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. 

Cinthia shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter the job market as soon as possible. Cinthia plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With one older sibling attending college already, Cinthia is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. 

Cinthia's father works as a electrician and his salary is the family's primary source of income. For a family of six, finances have always been tight. To help out, Cinthia began working at age 23 (and continues to work 25 hours a week.) To help afford her school and living expenses, Cinthia currently works 25 hours a week as a teacher.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: After graduating junior high,  Elizabeth set up her own jewelry business in Location (near Cape Coast). With over seven years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more jewelry for resale. She plans to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who sells second hand clothes, with the upkeep of their house and ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry

loans.name: César Iván

texts.es: César es un hombre soltero que a sus 38 años de edad se dedica a la producción agropecuaria. Es zootecnista de profesión y actualmente posee cultivos de caña y cilantro, cría aves y tiene ganado productor de leche; adicionalmente trabaja en una unidad productiva de frutas y verduras en convenio con el Sena. Todo esto le genera ingresos para solventar sus necesidades básicas y aportar para el sostenimiento de sus padres. César es un hombre trabajador, conocedor y apasionado por su labor, está en constante búsqueda de nuevas opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esta razón, encuentra en el crédito un apoyo, pues desea incursionar en el cultivo de maracuyá, para lo cual invertirá el dinero; comprará abonos, fertilizantes, vitaminas y fungicidas para adecuar el terreno y poder trasplantar las plantas del semillero y realizar mantenimiento a sus otros cultivos. Con esto tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer más variedad de productos en el mercado y podrá sacar una cosecha de excelente calidad, para vender los productos a mejor precio, así seguirá creciendo y avanzará hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es tener una unidad productiva sostenible y perdurable en el tiempo, que le genere mayor rentabilidad para poder gozar de mejores condiciones de vida y ofrecer a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: César is single man of 38 who works in agricultural and livestock farming.  He is a zootechnician by profession and currently grows sugar cane and coriander, breeds poultry and has dairy cattle.  In addition, he works in a fruit and vegetable production unit under an agreement with SENA (the National Service of Professional Training).  This all generates income which he uses to cover his basic needs and support his parents.  César is hardworking, knowledgeable and passionate about his work, and always on the lookout for new opportunities to make progress.  For this reason, he considers the loan a big help because he wants to branch out into growing passion fruit, which is what he will use the loan for.  He will buy manure, fertiliser, vitamins and fungicide to prepare his land, transplant his plants from the seedbed and tend his other crops.  This will give him the opportunity to offer a greater variety of products at the market and to produce excellent crops so he can sell his products at higher prices.  This will enable him to continue growing and get closer to fulfilling his main goal of owning a sustainable and lasting production unit which will boost his profits and enable him to enjoy better living conditions and provide a better quality of life for his parents.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser, vitamins and fungicide to prepare his land, transplant his plants from the seedbed and tend his other crops.

loans.name: Griselda Ana

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Griselda's dream. To achieve her goal, Griselda has enrolled in the Universidad Domingo Savio. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Griselda plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Griselda currently works as a teaching assistant to help her afford her school and living expenses. She currently works 25 hours a week and earns $5 a day. 

With a career in business, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. With two older siblings, Griselda is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Ariana Araxa

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Ariana's dream. To achieve her goal, Ariana has enrolled in the Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana. She expects to graduate in December, 2016, but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue to afford her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. 

Ariana shares that it is important to her to graduate on time, so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. She plans to use the loan to pay for her tuition. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help her afford her school and living expenses, Ariana currently works 40 hours a week as an office assistant. Currently, she earns $20 a day, but with a degree in business, she expects to earn $34 a day. 

As the youngest of four, with two older siblings attending college already, Ariana is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. This loan is administered by Vittana's partner, Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Pamela Andrea

texts.en:
Pamela dreams of becoming a professional. She was accepted into the Universidad Católica Boliviana San Pablo, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

Pamela expects to graduate in August, 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue to afford her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. 

Pamela shares that it is important to her to graduate on time, so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. She plans on using the loan to pay for her tuition. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Pamela currently works 20 hours a week to help her afford her school and living expenses. With a career in business, she expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

With two older siblings, Pamela is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has always dreamt of becoming a professional. She is currently attending the Instituto Tecnico Señor De Mayo, working towards her degree in nursing. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Catherine plans on using the loan to pay her graduation fees. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Catherine currently works 30 hours a week and earns $10 a day as a medical assistant to help her afford her school and living expenses. With a career in nursing, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner, Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Gabriel Juan

texts.en:
Gabriel has always dreamt of becoming a professional. He was accepted into the Universidad Cefi Sant Paul and now with the chance to achieve his dream, he is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

 Gabriel plans on using the funds from the loan to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his job. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Gabriel currently works 40 hours a week as an accountant and earns $19 a day. With a career in business, he expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling already attending college, Gabriel is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Gabriel is married with his own children but this has not stopped him from pursing his dreams. With a professional degree and a career in business, he will be able to provide his family with a better life. Gabriel's father's salary from his job as a tailor is the family's primary source of income. For a family of four, finances have always been tight. To help out, Gabriel began working at age 26 (and continues to work 40 hours a week.) 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Zenaida Waldi

texts.en:
Zenaida has always dreamt of becoming a professional. Zenaida was accepted into the Universidad Los Andes and now with the chance to achieve her dream she is concerned about affording textbooks. She plans on graduating in March, 2015 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

With this loan, Zenaida plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them Zenaida hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Zenaida currently works 30 hours a week as a salesperson and earns $15 a day to help afford her school and living expenses. 

With a degree in Commercial Engineering she expects to earn $22 a day. With one older sibling already attending college, Zenaida is unsure how she will be able to afford her textbooks on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Pamela Roxana

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Pamela's dream. Pamela is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards her degree in Physical Therapy. She plans on graduating in September, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Pamela plans on using this loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in Physical Therapy before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Pamela currently works 30 hours a week as an independent contractor and earns $9 a day. With a career in Physical Therapy, she expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase. With six siblings, Pamela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. 

 This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Diego Omar

texts.en:
Diego dreams of becoming a lawyer, but without a degree, he knows it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, Diego has enrolled in the Universidad Católica Boliviana San Pablo. He plans on graduating in March, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Diego plans to use this loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in law before graduating. 

One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently, Diego works 30 hours a week as a procurement specialist and earns $8 a day. With a degree in law, he expects to earn $25 a day. With one younger sister, Diego hopes to be a role model for his younger sibling by being the first in his family to graduate from university. 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner, Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for his graduation fees.

Nieves plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies she feels she will be able to get better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. 

Nieves currently works 30 hours a week and earns $5 a day as an Assistant to help afford her school and living expenses. With a degree in carpentry she expects to earn $10 a day. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Nieves hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university.  

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for books

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

With one younger brother and one younger sister, Ariane hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

Daira dreams of becoming a professional. Daira was accepted into the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording graduation fees. She expects to graduate in September 2013 but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. Daira currently works 30 hours a week as a consultant to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús es un señor de 68 años de edad, casado y padre de 10 hijos. Nació y  se crió en el campo donde aprendió las labores agrícolas, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, pero hace 35 años fue desplazado por la violencia que se presentó y junto con su esposa y sus hijos salieron de su pueblo natal, dejando atrás todo lo que habían conseguido con esfuerzo. Se radicaron en otro pueblo de Antioquia, donde llegaron en busca de nuevas oportunidades que les permitiera comenzar nuevamente desde cero. Hoy en día, luego de un arduo trabajo en diferentes fincas, ha podido conseguir su vivienda propia, donde posee cultivos de aguacate con aproximadamente 40 palos, cultivo de maíz y de arracacha y, las cosechas que saca, son vendidas en el mercado del pueblo; así obtiene los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades de su familia. Jesús manifiesta que su edad no es impedimento para hacer lo que le gusta y siempre está en constante actividad cuidando sus cultivos, pues es su fuente de ingresos y, en algunas temporadas cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador al jornal. 
Solicita el crédito para darle continuidad al cuidado de sus cultivos, pues será invertido en la compra de abonos, riegos, fungicidas, fertilizantes y pesticidas necesarios para poder sacar una cosecha con productos de muy buena calidad, que puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio y así aumentar sus ingresos. Jesús espera que en corto plazo su negocio crezca, especialmente el cultivo de aguacates, así podrá tener más recursos para disfrutar de mejores condiciones y calidad de vida y, pasar una vejez más tranquila al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jesús, 68, is married with 10 children. He was born and raised in the countryside, where he learned about farm work from his father. However, he was displaced 35 years ago due to violence. Along with his wife and children, he left his native town, leaving behind everything they had worked so hard to achieve.

They settled down in another town, Antioquia, where they arrived in search of new opportunities to start over. After difficult work on various farms, he managed to get his own home, where he has 40 avocado trees and crops of corn and arracacha (a root vegetable). The harvests are sold in the town marketplace. With this work, he earns enough to cover his family's needs. Jesús says that his age does not prevent him from doing what he likes. He is constantly active and taking care of his crops, because this is his source of income. During some seasons, he has the support of a daily laborer. 

He has applied for a loan to continue caring for his crops. He will invest this loan in the purchase of manure, an irrigation system, fungicides, fertilizer, and pesticides, which are necessary for a good-quality harvest. He will sell his products at a better price, thus increasing his income. Jesús hopes that his business grows in the short term, especially his avocado crops. He will then have more resources to enjoy better financial conditions and a better quality of life, giving him a peaceful old age alongside his wife.

loans.use: to buy manure, an irrigation system, fungicides, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Salomey's Group

texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs. One of them, Salomey, is a 25 years old and the single mother of one child. She earns a living by selling clothing out of her home, and is seeking this loan to buy dresses and men's shirts to sell. We see Salomey on the right in the photograph. Mavis is another member. She is 28 years old and earns a living by selling women's undergarments. Ramatu is 29 years old and earns a living by selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepcion, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Wilma es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro de la ciudad donde tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de prendas de todo tipo, la cual  sale también a vender en otros lugares sus productos.
